jeune_Trie
Class CluePanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  jeune_Trie.CluePanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, BoardContentsObserver, ClueObserver, CurrentObserver, RegionObserver
public class CluePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements RegionObserver, CurrentObserver, BoardContentsObserver, ClueObserver

There will be two of these at the same time. One will hold the Across Clues and the other will hold the Down Clues. When a user wants to set a Clue for a region on the board, the Clue will end up in the appropriate panel. Clicking on a Clue in one of the panels should bring that region up on the board.

See Also:
Serialized Form

startPanel

updateRegion

public void updateRegion()
(non-Javadoc)

Specified by:
updateRegion in interface RegionObserver
See Also:
This function should update this CluePanel's selected value, if it is not the same as the one that exists when this function was called. If we are the same orientation as the board, we should update ourselves to have the ActiveRegion as our selected value. If we have the opposite orientation as the board; then we should have as semi-selected the Clue that corresponds to the Region that would be formed if Current was in the opposite Orientation of what it is now.

updateCurrent

public void updateCurrent()

updateCurrent in interface CurrentObserver

updateBoardContents

public void updateBoardContents()
Specified by:
updateBoardContents in interface BoardContentsObserver

updateClue

public void updateClue()
UPDATECLUE should update the clue associated with the proper place on the board. Preconditions: Board should be set up. Postconditions: The Clue associated with the Region on the board that just had its Clue reset showed show that it has changed.

Specified by:
updateClue in interface ClueObserver
See Also:
jeune_Trie.BoardContentsObserver#updateClue()

setIndexPosition

public void setIndexPosition(int anIndex,
                             java.lang.String aClue)
SETLISTPOSITION will allow the inputted index in the list to be set to the inputted string. If the inputted position does not exist, nothing will happen Preconditions: The inputted index should exists. The inputted String should be in the format: ###.) STRING Index should be > 0. Postconditions: The inputted index's String will be changed to that of the passed in String.
